newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia says no plans to raise taxes.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia says no plans to raise taxes.

text.p: Coordinating Minister for Economics and Finance Saleh Afiff said on Monday Indonesia had no plans to raise tax rates in the 1997/98 (April-March) fiscal year.
"... this budget does not plan to raise tax rates," he told a briefing ahead of President Suharto's 1997/98 budget address to parliament on Monday.
Afiff said the government would focus on improving tax administration and tax collection to increase revenues from income and value-added taxes.

Data released by the minister showed revenue from income and value-added taxes were expected to rise 22.8 and 12.9 percent respectively from the current 1996/97 budget and would account for 53.14 percent, or 53.72 trillion rupiah, of the 1997/98 budget.
